adjective.description: Chiefly Science. Having several or many centres.
Mycology. Of the thallus of fungi of the order Chytridiales: having more than one centre of growth and development.
Cell Biology. Of a chromosome or chromatid: = multicentric.

noun.description: Cell Biology. A multicentric chromosome or chromatid.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Harry Marshall Ward (1854–1906). From poly- + -centric. Compare post-classical Latin policentricus, French polycentrique, Italian policentrico, all in sense having several or many centres.
